title: WillyAp
author: WillyAp
content: Litecoin has gone thru an update unlike many others. I think LTC deserves a little more attention. Sure everyone holding a coins & wishes for exactly that but hardly any (crypto) has done as much with so few people. What do you think?

comments.author: paid2
comments.body: Personally one of the only real usage I have for Litecoin is the fact that it can be merge-mined with Dogecoin. It makes mining with Scrypt profitable (even if the profitability is boosted by Doge principally).I use it from time to time to buy BTC at ATMs, when BTC fees are too high (Ordinals hurt me haha). Once the mempool empties a bit, I exchange it for BTC, I lose 1% in fees but it's not a big deal. I have to admit that it's very convenient for that too.When it comes to cheap transactions Litecoin stands up well but could be replaced by other more efficient altcoins. In any case Litecoin is definitely useful (from a strictly personal point of view) for particular purposes, but I can't think of any other coin that can surpass it in its category. I'm curious, why are you so bullish on LTC? Is it for the speed of transactions? Low fees?

comments.author: d5000
comments.body: I generally think that the crypto world needs at least 2 or 3 strong decentralized chains (i.e. not managed by a closed team which premined or instamined most of them or sold them in an ICO) apart from Bitcoin.Currently Litecoin, Dogecoin and Monero are the most prominent ones. And as Litecoin is easier to use than Monero, and is not as hypervolatile (and Musk-dependant) as Doge, I support the notion that it is sort of "underrated". Even if it is used quite a lot actually.There used to be Dash but it has lost ground and also its decentralization is less marked. I think the current best contender to complement BTC, LTC, DOGE and XMR is Kaspa but its launch wasn't as fair as LTCs (more comparable to Dash) and thus the centralization dangers are higher.

comments.body: Litecoin has slowly gained grounds in the space after Bitcoin, the fact that people trust the security level on Litecoin also puts it in the spotlight of coins to look out for. Charlie lee is always rolling out updates and upgrades with his team, it makes more people believe in the project and are slowly adopting it. If Litecoin should have a smart contract enabled feature in the longrun, it'll give ethereum a good match for the technology.
